title: 111_s3238
content: The Act may be cited as the "Fallen Heroes of 9/11 Act". Congressional findings are also included in the Act. The tragic deaths on September 11, 2001, have forever changed our nation. The heroic actions of officers, emergency workers, and employees who responded to the attacks at the World Trade Center and the Pentagon are acknowledged. The heroic actions of individuals during the 9/11 attacks, including Pentagon employees, passengers and crew of United Airlines Flight 93, deserve recognition with an appropriate medal. SEC. 3. FALLEN HEROES OF 9/11 CONGRESSIONAL MEDALS. The President is authorized to award the "Fallen Heroes of 9/11 Congressional Medal" to individuals and organizations in recognition of their sacrifices on and after September 11, 2001. The Secretary of the Treasury will strike 3 designs for the medal presentations. The Secretary of the Treasury will strike 3 designs of medals to honor those who lost their lives in the 9/11 attacks at the World Trade Center, Pentagon, and Flight 93. The Secretary of the Treasury will strike silver and gold medals to honor individuals who died as a direct result of the 9/11 terrorist attacks in the United States. Eligibility for the medal includes those who lost their lives at the Pentagon, including the passengers and crew of American Airlines Flight 77. Consultation with the Secretary of Defense and other relevant parties will be conducted before finalizing the design of the medal. Individuals who died as a result of the 9/11 terrorist attacks in the United States are eligible for a medal determined by the Secretary in consultation with relevant officials. The Secretary will create duplicate bronze medals for recipients of the medals awarded under section 3, to be displayed at their duty stations in memory of those who responded to the 9/11 attacks and perished. This includes officers, emergency workers, and government employees who were directly affected by the act of terrorism. Establishment of lists of recipients. The Secretary will establish lists of individuals eligible for a medal under the Act, including victims from September 11, 2001. Consultation with specific offices will be done for making determinations. The Secretary will establish lists of individuals eligible for a medal under the Act, including victims from September 11, 2001, maintained by various organizations. Determinations are final and not subject to judicial review. If eligible, individuals will be promptly added to the appropriate list. The Secretary may sell duplicate bronze medals to the public to cover costs. The medals struck under this Act are considered national medals.
